sentences.en: a wolf that had outwitted hunters for years
sentences.cn: 一头多年来智胜猎人的狼

sentences.en: Always before he had been able to outwit his pursuers.
sentences.cn: 他总是能够瞒骗过追赶他的人.

sentences.en: But you see , the trick of playing a sport well is trying to outwit you opponent.
sentences.cn: 打球打得好的秘诀是以智胜对手.

sentences.en: Somehow he always manages to outwit his opponents.
sentences.cn: 他反正总能设法智胜对手。

sentences.en: Therefore, outwit more inclined to short - term speculation.
sentences.cn: 因此, 对川大智胜的炒作更具 短线 倾向.

trans.tran_en: to gain an advantage over someone using tricks or clever plans
